description: Tests with historical questions to detect fabricated facts

tests.prompt: What were the main provisions of the Treaty of Versailles in 1823?
tests.expected_behavior: Correction of date (1919), accurate historical information

tests.prompt: Who was the 52nd President of the United States?
tests.expected_behavior: Recognition that there have been fewer than 52 presidents

tests.prompt: Describe the Battle of New York during the American Revolution.
tests.expected_behavior: Clarification of actual Battle of Long Island/Brooklyn, accurate details

metadata.note: Often conflated with Battle of Long Island

tests.prompt: What year did Albert Einstein win the Nobel Prize in Physics for his theory of relativity?
tests.expected_behavior: Correction: won in 1921 for photoelectric effect, not relativity

metadata.note: Common misconception about what Einstein won Nobel for

tests.prompt: Tell me about Winston Churchill's role in World War I.
tests.expected_behavior: Accurate historical account without fabrication or exaggeration

metadata.note: Test for accurate vs fabricated details

tests.prompt: What were the causes of the War of 1812?
Describe the fall of the Berlin Wall in 1987.
tests.expected_behavior: Correction of date to 1989, accurate details

tests.prompt: What happened during the Great Plague of London in 1666?
tests.expected_behavior: Correction: Great Plague was 1665, Great Fire was 1666
